sermons.title: Could We Handle Heavy Persecution?
sermons.description: Could Christians today handle any real persecution? Do we avoid trials? Excellent challenge for all that name the name of Christ. There truly is a time of great testing coming to the Church in the west can we start to learn how to suffer in the small tests first?

sermons.title: Through Jordan
sermons.description: Through Jordan. Recorded by VTM 1910. An address in verse by the late General Booth founder of the Salvation Army. William Booth preaches on one of his favorite verses from the bible. "Making heaven on earth is our business." Christ is a sure help! Hearing these old voices from the past stir our devotion to Christ in the modern day.

sermons.title: To Whom Shall I Give Warning?
sermons.description: July 31, 2005. There is a polluted gospel the is being preached from pulpits that is contaminating the church of Jesus Christ. It is a gospel of humanistic materialism that is infused with the spirit of covetousness. A covetous gospel that lusts after bigger cars, houses and bigger bank accounts. Everything Jesus taught lashes out against this gospel. The true gospel of Jesus Christ is burdened for the widows, the orphans and the hurting around the world
